page.title: 02GAINSBOROUGH OLD HALL
page.content: Gainsborough Old Hall. The Old Hall is a 15th century manor house.It was built in the first half of the 15th century by Sir Thomas Burgh . In 1470 the house was partly destroyed by the Lancastrians during the wars of the Roses.Sir William added the East wing between 1597 and 1600. The last of Hickmans was Dame Frances Hickman who died unmarried in 1826 .The manor was bequeathed to a nephew Henry Bacon who became Henry Hickman Bacon Esq.The last lord of the manor to die in Gainsborough was Sir Hickman Beckett Bacon,premier Baronet of England,another bachelor. The estate then went to Sir Edmund Bacon of Norfolk.The Hickmans ceased to live in the Old Hall in the 17th century.This famous building,recently restored,attracts many tourists to Gainsborough.
